text: Patrick Savage (19 November 1882 – 9 November 1969) was a Scottish professional football goalkeeper who played in the Scottish League for Cowdenbeath, Dunfermline Athletic and St Bernard's. He also served as assistant trainer at King's Park. == Personal life == Savage worked as a miner and his uncle James also played football as a full back for Cowdenbeath. In 1915, during the first 12 months of the First World War, he enlisted in the Fife and Forfar Yeomanry and his battalion would later become a member of the Black Watch. Savage saw action during the Mesopotamian campaign and on the Western Front. After the war, he returned to work as a miner and later as a barman. == References == Category:Scottish footballers Category:1969 deaths Category:Black Watch soldiers Category:British Army personnel of World War I Category:1882 births Category:Scottish Football League players Category:Cowdenbeath F.C. players Category:People from Cowdenbeath Category:Dunfermline Athletic F.C. players Category:Reading F.C. wartime guest players Category:St Bernard's F.C. players Category:Scottish miners Category:Bartenders Category:King's Park F.C. players Category:Association football goalkeepers
title: Pat Savage
